body: I feel like this NTR is really more of a cautionary tale with communication being at the center of it all. It's made pretty clear that Irena isn't bothered by the prospect of losing the temple, as long as she was with him, it didn't matter; a conclusion that Tachi makes much too late. Tachi understandably felt the weight of his parent's legacy and wanted to do anything and everything he could to save the temple. However, his desperation would cost him greatly. By being so focused on saving the temple, he negated listening to Irena, something he does often throughout the doujinshi. Irena was probably the only good person who understood him and was willing to believe in him regardless. Likewise, Lord Morozov recognized Tachi's struggles as well, uses them to exploit him and Irena. Tachi believed that happiness would be achieved after he had saved the temple, after he became a man, , after he was wed, when in reality, happiness was right beside him in Irena.

Perhaps he knew this fact and assumed that she would always be there for him, taking her for granted. If there is anything to be learned from this doujinshi, is that you cannot wait for happiness to appear. "Your Life in 4 Panels" by Merryweather Comics is a great example of waiting and assuming that happiness will show up. Happiness is not a reward gained from a promotion, it is something that comes from within and the people you love. When you prioritize something above being happy, that is where you will fall. Tachi wanted Irena to be happy after he had fixed everything, waiting until happiness came to him. So, to any who read this far, don't wait for happiness to fall from the sky get out there and look for it. Do NOT take shortcuts, you may have to step out of your comfort zone but will find it. Never forget to talk with your partner, the simple act of two-way communication can make all the difference. Also, read the fine print of anything you sign.
